data.title: Drinks
data.text: We rarely go to Cabreras because we have friends at another great Mexican place in town,  but we went recently for a going away party they handled our large group with no problem.  Good food fast with no order mistakes.  Drinks were cold and delicious not much more you can ask for.

data.title: Yum!
data.text:
Close to Lost River Cave. The food was delicious and the service was great. Yummy chips/salsa. The kids' menu included non-mexican options. 

We had a groupon and they gave it back to us to use a second time. Bonus!

data.title: Fresh but bland
data.text: A friend from El Salvador likes this place, so we gave it a try. The salsa tasted fresh, the meat was fresh and the ground beef was better than what's served in most Mexican restaurants. But good Mexican spices were missing. The chicken wings were also bland. We wanted to try the fried ice cream, but they served us the sopapilla fixed like an ice cream sundae. Good, but not what we wanted. Most of the dishes were 7.99 or less. The draft beer was the best deal. 32 ounces for only 3.99! Not really worth the extra gas to get here

data.title: Whatever they call it, it isn't Mexican
data.text: Ate here in January '14. Their idea of enchiladas is meat or beans rolled in a corn tortilla with sauce drizzled on it. They had no guacamole, even though the items we ordered were supposed to have it; when we asked about it, they offered some cut up green avocado  and then charged us extra for it. The service is friendly but slow (one dish at a time; for a party of four, that meant that the first person served was done by the time the last one was served). My advice: Avoid.
